verses.verse: Sing aloud <S%H7442><s%> to God, <S%H430><s%> our strength! <S%H5797><s%> Make a joyful shout <S%H7321><s%> to the God <S%H430><s%> of Jacob! <S%H3290><s%>
Raise <S%H5375><s%> a song, <S%H2172><s%> and bring <S%H5414><s%> here the tambourine, <S%H8596><s%> the pleasant <S%H5273><s%> lyre <S%H3658><s%> with the harp. <S%H5035><s%>
Blow <S%H8628><s%> the trumpet <S%H7782><s%> at the New Moon, <S%H2320><s%> at the full moon, <S%H2320><s%> on our feast <S%H2282><s%> day. <S%H3117><s%>
For it is a statute <S%H2706><s%> for Israel, <S%H3478><s%> an ordinance <S%H4941><s%> of the God <S%H430><s%> of Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>

He appointed <S%H7760><s%> it in Joseph <S%H3084><s%> for a testimony, <S%H5715><s%> when he went out <S%H3318><s%> over the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> I heard <S%H8085><s%> a language <S%H8193><s%> that I didn't <S%H3045><s%> know.
"I removed <S%H5493><s%> his shoulder <S%H7926><s%> from the burden. <S%H5447><s%> His hands <S%H3709><s%> were freed <S%H5674><s%> from the basket. <S%H1731><s%>

You called <S%H7121><s%> in trouble, <S%H6869><s%> and I delivered <S%H2502><s%> you. <S%H6030><s%> I answered you in the secret place <S%H5643><s%> of thunder. <S%H7482><s%> I tested <S%H974><s%> you at the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Meribah. <S%H4809><s%>" Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
"Hear, <S%H8085><s%> my people, <S%H5971><s%> and I will testify <S%H5749><s%> to you, <S%H3478><s%> Israel, if you would listen to me! <S%H8085><s%>
There shall be no strange <S%H2114><s%> god <S%H410><s%> in you, <S%H7812><s%> neither shall you worship any foreign <S%H5236><s%> god. <S%H410><s%>

I am Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> your God, <S%H430><s%> who brought <S%H5927><s%> you up out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%> Open your mouth <S%H6310><s%> wide, <S%H7337><s%> and I will fill it. <S%H4390><s%>
But my people <S%H5971><s%> didn't <S%H8085><s%> listen to my voice. <S%H6963><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> desired none of me. <S%H14><s%>
So I let them go <S%H7971><s%> after the stubbornness <S%H8307><s%> of their hearts, <S%H3820><s%> that they might walk <S%H3212><s%> in their own counsels. <S%H4156><s%>
Oh <S%H3863><s%> that my people <S%H5971><s%> would listen <S%H8085><s%> to me, <S%H3478><s%> that Israel would walk <S%H1980><s%> in my ways! <S%H1870><s%>
I would soon <S%H4592><s%> subdue <S%H3665><s%> their enemies, <S%H341><s%> and turn <S%H7725><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> against their adversaries. <S%H6862><s%>
The haters <S%H8130><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> would cringe <S%H3584><s%> before him, <S%H6256><s%> and their punishment would last forever. <S%H5769><s%>
But he would have also fed <S%H398><s%> them with the finest <S%H2459><s%> of the wheat. <S%H2406><s%> I will satisfy <S%H7646><s%> you with honey <S%H1706><s%> out of the rock. <S%H6697><s%>"
